ï»¿OFFICIAK TFNR The World Bank , , p er Telephone: (66) 0 26868300 INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPME DPthumwan Facsimile: (66) 0 26868301 INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION Bangkok 10330, Thaland www.worldbank.or.th November 9, 2012 Mr. Garvan McCann Head of Development Embassy of Ireland Floor 2, Sentinel Place Building 41A Ly Thai To Street Hanoi Vietnam Trust Fund Administratiou Arrangement between the Irish Aid and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the International Development Association concerning the Second Trade Development Facility Multi-Donor Trust Fund (TFNo. TFO71941) Dear Mr. McCann: 1. We are pleased to acknowledge on behalf of the International Bank for Riconstruction and Development ("IBRD") and the International Development A,;sociation ("IDA") (collectively, the "Bank") that Irish Aid (the "Donor") will make awailable as a grant the surr of one hundred thousand Euro (EUR100,000.00) (the "Contribution") for the Secoad -rade Development Facility Trust Fund (the "Trust Fiuid") in accordance with the terms of this Arrangement. Other donors are also eNpected to contribute to the Trust Fund on the terms and conditions specified in the A nexes to this Arrangement. 2. The Contribution will be used to finance the activities and the categories of expenditure set forth in the "Description of Activities, Expenditures and Governance A -angements for the Second Trade Development Facility Trust Fund" attached hereto as A mex 1, and will be admini.tered by the Bank on behalf of the Donor in accordance wi-h the terms of this Arrangement including the "Standard Provisions Applicable to the Second Trade Development FaciLty Trust Fund" (the "Standard Provisions") attached hereto as Annex 2. 3. The Donor shall depo.it the Contribution into such bank account designated by the Bank promptly following countersignature of this Agreement by the Donor and submission of a payment requ(st by the Bank. 4. When making each such deposit, the Donor will instruct its bank to include in its payment details information (remittance advice) field of its SWIFT payment message, information indicating: the amount paid, that the payment is made by the Donor for TF071941 (the Second Trade Development Facility Trust Fund), and the date of the de-osit (the "Deposit Instruction"). In addition, the Donor will provide a copy of the
ï»¿Mr. Garvan McCann -2- November 9, 2012 D,nor's Deposit Instruction to the Bank's Accounting Trust Funds Division by e-mail sent to tfremitadvice@worldbenk.crg or by fax sent to (202) 614-1315. 5. The Bank will convert the Contribution funds into the holding currency of the Trust Fund, namely United States Dollars, promptly upon receipt of the Contribution funds and the Deposit Instruction containing the information specified in paragraph 4 at th, exchange rate obtained by the Bank on the date of the conversion. Where the Contribution proves to be insu -ficient to complete the activities as a result of an exchange rate fluctuation, neither the Baik nDr the Donor will bear any responsibility for providing any additional financing. 6. Except as provided f)r in paragraph 4 above, any notice, request or other communication to be given or made under this Arrangement be in writing and delivered by mail, facsimile or e-mail to the respective party's address specified below or at such other address as such party notifies in writing to the other party from time to time: For the Bank: Richard Record Trade Specialis:, EASPT The World Ban( Nehru Road Vientiane Lao PDR Tel: +856-21-:266200 Fax: +856-21-256299 E-mail: rrecord@worldbank.org For the Donor: Garvan McCai Head of Development Embassy of Ireland Floor 2, Sentinel Place Building 41A Ly Thai To Street Hanoi Vietnam Tel: +84-4-3974-3291 Fax: +84-4-3974-3295 E-mail: garvan. nccann@dfa.ie 7. All annexes hereto constitute an integral part of this Agreement. This A--angement be amended only in writing between the Bank and the Donor; provided,
ï»¿Mr. Garvan McCann -3- November 9, 2012 however, that such annexes may be amended only with the agreement of all donors centributing to the Trust Fund. 8. Please confirm your a),reement with the foregoing, on behalf of the Donor, by signing, dating, and returning to us the enclosed copy of this Arrangement. Upon receipt by the Bank of the copy of this A rrangement countersigned by you, this Arrangement w I become effective as of the datc of the countersignature. Sincerely, INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT/ INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION Julia Fraser Ac ing Country Director, Lao PDR -ast Asia and Pacific Region AGREED: IRISH AID N ume: Garvan McCann Title: Head of Development Date: Os-7tt/ -
ï»¿Mr. Garvan McCann -4- November 9, 2012 ANNEX 1 Description of Activities, Expenditures and Governance Arrangements for the Second Trade Development Facility Trust Fund This Annex will be a)plicable to and form an integral part of all agreements ertered into between the Bank and entities (collectively, the "Donors") that provide contributions (the aggregate of all contributions from the Donors, the "Contributions") to be administered by the Bank for the Trust Fund. A.. DESCRIPTION OF ACTIVITIES The proposed program development objective is to support the implementation of Government of Lao PDR's trade and integration priorities outlined in the 2012 Diagnostic Trade Integration Study (DTIS) Roadmap, and in particular to contribute to improved competitiveness and diversificatior, focusing outside the natural resource sectors. (1) Recipient-Executed Trust Fund Activities: (a) Trade Facilitation, Trade Policy and Regulations: Provision of te:hnical assistance to impiove the effectiveness of institutional frameworks for mu-.iaging trade facilitation, improved transparency, streamlined non tariff measures, and a nore coherent trade policy o 1 goods and services. (b) Diversification and Competitiveness: Provision of technical as istance and direct matching grants to: (i) improve private sector competitiveness ou:side the resource sectors; and (ii) improve labor standards and productivity in the mmufacturing sector. (c) Mainstreaming Aid for Trade: Provision of technical assistance to build the capacity of the aid fo trade governance structure, support implementation of the 2012 DTIS and more effectiveLy measure the impact of trade policy. (2) Bank-Executed Trust Fund Activities: (a) Implementation support of the recipient-executed portion of the MDTF: ISRs for the recipient-executed project. Aide Memoires from periodic joint do:ior supervision missions and day-to-day implementation support. (b) Comple -entary analytical and advisory activities: AAA outputs to be determined according to standard Bank ESW/TA procedures and based on the rolling trade and competitiveness engagement strategy note for Lao PDR. (c) Prograrr. ma:agement and trust fund administration.
ï»¿Mr. Garvan McCann -5- November 9, 2012 B. CATEGORIES OF EXPENDITURE (1) For Bank-Executed activities, the Contributions may be used to finance: (a) associated overheads; (b: consultant fees individuals and firms; (c) contractual services; (d) extended term consultants; (e) media, workshop, conference and Meeting; (fi staff costs - with indirec costs; (g) temporary support staff costs; and (i) travel services. (2) For Recipient. Executed activities, the Contributions may be used to finance (a) civil works; (b) consultant services; (c) goods; (d) operating costs; (e) training; and (f) other. C. GOVERNANCE STRUCTURE A Trade Program Executiv. Committee (acting as the TDF Steering Committee) w'I be maintained throughout the duration of the Project which will be co-chaired by a senior representative of the Miristry of Industry and Commerce and by a donor representative agreed by the donors, with representatives of: (a) the Recipient; (b) the dcl ors who provide financing to the MDTF; (c) the Association; and (d) other key stakeholders invited as observers. The Trade Program Executive Committee shall, inter al i: (a) provide general oveisight and strategic direction, including endorsing annual w:ik plans to be financed inder the MDTF, based on a selection of actions from the D YSS Roadmap and joint identifications, preparation and appraisal missions which have taien place; and (b) review periodic financial and progress reports, prepared by the N it'Lonal Implementation Unit. The World Bank, as administrator of the MDTF will: (a) ensure that funds are usVd in accordance with approvec work programs and will have the final authority to approve projects, programs or actions in accordance with its procedures; (b) be responsible for calling developmeit partner meetings and donor coordination, generate ccinmitments, carry out day-:.o-day management of the MDTF, ensure that activities ccntinue and are well-sequenc -d across the components, and provide technical assistance to :he NIU, implementing departments and agencies. The National Impleme:itation Unit will be responsible for : (a) drafting of action pl3ns and proposals; (b) coordination of the inputs of technical implementing departments and agencies; (c coordination of the preparation of work plans, progress reports and financial reports; and (d) procurement and financial management arrangements and correspondence in accordance with World Bank rules and procedures; ard (e) providing any other inputs to the Trade Executive Committee on issues related to policy, strategy and program implementation.
ï»¿Mr. Garvan McCann -6- November 9, 2012 ANNEX 2 Standard Provisions Applicable to the Second Trade Development Facility Trust Fund This Annex will be a)plicable to and form an integral part of all agreements entered into between the ink and the Donors that provide Contributions to be administered by the Bank for tie Trust Fund. 1. Administration of the Contributions 1.1. The Bank will be responsible only for performing those functions specifically set forth in this Arrangement and will not be subject to any other duties or responsibilities to th. Donors, including, withou. limitation, any duties or obligations that might otherwise apply to a fiduciary or trustee ander general principles of trust or fiduciary law. Nothing in this Arrangement will be considered a waiver of any privileges or immunities of the IBRD and IDA under their Ar.icle, of Agreement or any applicable law, all of which are eN pressly reserved. 1. The Contribution will be administered in accordance with the Bank's applicable po icies and procedures, as th same may be amended from time to time, including its framework to prevent and combat fraud and corruption and its screening procedures to pr,vent the use of Bank resoirces to finance terrorist activity, in line with the Bank's oth igations to give effect to the relevant decisions of the Security Council, taken under C)z,pter VII of the of Charter of the United Nations. The Donor acknowledges that this provision does not create any obligations of the Bank under the anti-terrorist financing ar d asset control laws, regula:ions, rules and executive orders of an individual member ccuntry that may apply to the Donor, nor will it be deemed a waiver, express or implied, of any of the privileges and immunities of the Bank. 2. Comminaling, Exchanye ar d Investment of the Contributions 2.1. The Contributions will be accounted for as a single trust fund and will be kept separate and apart from the ft nds of the Bank. The Contributions may be commingled w :h other trust fund assets maintained by the Bank. 2.. The Contributions may be freely exchanged by the Bank into other currencies as may facilitate their disbursement. 2.3. The Bank will invest and reinvest the Contributions pending their disbursement in accordance with the Bank's policies and procedures for the investment of trust funds administered by the Bank. Te Bank will credit all income from such investment to the Trist Fund to be used for the same purposes as the Contributions.
ï»¿Mr. Garvan McCann -7- November 9, 2012 3. Administrative Cost R:covery In order to assist in 1he defrayment of the costs of administration and other expenses incurred by the Bank under this Agreement, the Bank may deduct and retain for it, own account an amount equal to two percent (2%) of each Contribution from the Contributions. In addition, costs for program management and administration up to a m3ximum of three and sixty-f(ur hundredths percent (3.64%) will be charged to the Trust Fuid on an actual basis. If the contributions increase beyond what was originally expected at the time of count,.r-signature of the first administration agreement, and the administrative costs increase as a result, the Donors acknowledge that an additional administrative fee may be applied to such new contributions. 4. Grants to Recipients 4.1. The Bank shall, as adninisErator of the Trust Fund on behalf of the Donors, enter into a grant agreement (the "Grant Agreement") with (the "Recipient") selected in accordance with the goveman-e terms of Annex 1 (the "Recipient") consistent with the purposes of this Arrangemeni and on the terms and conditions set forth in the Grant A,2reement. Grant Agreement may be entered into up to the maximum amount of the Contributions that all Donors have agreed to make available under the Administration A eements between the Bank and the Donors. Upon request by a Donor, the Bank will fuirish a copy of the Grant Agreement to the Donors. 4.,. The Bank will be responsible for the supervision of the activities financed under th: Grant Agreement. Subject to the consent of the relevant Recipient, representatives of th: Donors may be invited ty the Bank to participate in Bank supervision missions re I ated to the Trust Fund. 4.3. The Bank will promptly inform the Donors of any significant modification to the te:rns of any Grant Agreemer. anc of any contractual remedies that are exercised by the Bank under any Grant Agreement. To the extent practicable, the Bank will afford the D,nors the opportunity to exchange views before effecting any such modification or eN ercising any such remedy. 5. Procurement 5.1. For Recipient-executed activities, the Grant Agreement will provide that the Contributions will be used by the Recipients to finance expenditures for goods and services, as the case may be, in accordance with the Bank's Guidelines on "Procurement under IBRD Loans and IDA Credits" and the Bank's Guidelines on the "Selection and Employment of Consultants by World Bank Borrowers," as in effect at the date of entry into the respective Grant Agreiment.
ï»¿Mr. Garvan McCann -8- November 9, 2012 5.3. For Bank-executed act'vitics, the employment and supervision of any consultants ar(d the procurement of any go:ds imanced by the Contributions will be the responsibility of the Bank and will be cairied out in accordance with its applicable policies and procedures. 6 Accounting and Financial Reporting 6.1. The Bank will mainta n separate records and ledger accounts in respect of the Contributions deposited in the Trust Fund account and disbursements made therefrom. 6.2. The Bank will furnis1 to the Donors current financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund balance in the holding currency of the Trust Fund with respect to the Contributions via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. Within six (6) months after all commitments and liabilities under the Trust Fund have been satisfied and the T -ust Fund has been closed, the final financial information relating to receipts, disbursern-nts and fund balance in the holding currency of the Trust Fuld with respect to the Contributions will be made available to the Donors via the World Bank's Trust Funds Do:ior Center secure website. 6.3. The Bank will provide to the Donors, within six (6) months following the end of each Bank fiscal year, an annua. single audit report, comprising (1) a management assertion together with an attestat on from the Bank's external auditors concerning the adequacy of internal control cver ash-based financial reporting for all cash-based trust funds as a whole; and (2) a comb:.ned financial statement for all cash-based trust funds to-,ether with the Bank's external auditor's opinion thereon. The cost of the single audit w I be borne by the Bank. 6.4. If a Donor wishes to reque 3t, on an exceptional basis, a financial statement audit by the Bank's external auditcrs of the Trust Fund, the Donor and the Bank will first consult as to whether such an external audit is necessary. The Bank and the Donor will agree on the appropriate scope and terms of reference of such audit. Following agreement on the scope and terms of reference, the Bank will arrange for such external ai.dit. The costs of any such audit, including the internal costs of the Bank with respect to such audit, will be paid by the requesting Donor. 6. 5. The Bank will provide the Donors with copies of all financial statements and aLditors' reports received b) the Bank from the Recipients pursuant to the Grant A2reement. 7. Progress Reporting 7.1. The Bank will provide the Donors with an annual report on the progress of activities financed by the Conlributions. Within six (6) months of the final disbursement daie specified in paragraph 8.2, the Bank will furnish to the Donors a final report on the activities financed by the Trusi Fund.
ï»¿Mr. Garvan McCann -9- November 9, 2012 7.. Any Donor may review or evaluate activities financed by the Trust Fund. The D,nor and the Bank will agree on the scope and conduct of such review or evaluation, ard the Bank will provide all relevant information within the limits of its policies and procedures. All associated costs will be borne by the Donor. It is understood that any such review or evaluation will not constitute a financial, compliance or other audit of the Trust Fund. 8. Disbursement; Cancellation; Refund 8.1 It is expected that thc Ccntributions will be fully disbursed by the Bank by September 30, 2017. The Bark w:1l only disburse Contributions for the purposes of this Al-angement after such date with the written approval of the Donors. 8.2 Any Donor or the Ban, may, upon three (3) months' prior written notice, cancel all or part of the Donor's pro rata share, of any remaining balance of the Contributions that is not committed pursuant to any agreements entered into between the Bank and any ccnsultants and/or other third parties for the purposes of this Arrangement prior to the re.eipt of such notice, including the Grant Agreement. 8.3. Following the final dibursement date specified in paragraph 8.1, the Bank will reLirn any remaining balance of the Contributions to the Donors or to the relevant Donor Balance Account on a pro rala basis based on the Donors' paid Contributions. In the e,,ent of a cancellation the Bank will promptly return to the relevant Donor or Donors or to the relevant Donor Balanoe Account the Donor's pro rata share of uncommitted Contributions in accordance with paragraph 8.2. 9. Disclosure The Bank will disclose this Arrangement and related information on this Trust Fund in accordance with the World Bank Policy on Access to Information. By entering into this Agreement, Donors consent to disclosure of this Arrangement and related information on this Trust Fund.
